newsitem.title: JAMAICA: Jamaican prime minister to visit Cuba.
newsitem.headline: Jamaican prime minister to visit Cuba.

text.p: Jamaican Prime Minister P.J. Patterson, who has just chaired a U.S.-Caribbean summit in Barbados, says he plans to pay an official visit to Cuba at the end of this month.
Patterson said late Monday he would visit Havana at the invitation of President Fidel Castro to discuss matters of "bilateral, regional and hemispheric concern."

At the May 10 summit between Caribbean leaders and U.S. President Bill Clinton, the region offered its assistance in "reintegrating Cuba into Caribbean-U.S. relations," Patterson told a press briefing after returning from the summit.
This was because Caribbean countries believed the U.S. policy of "embargo and isolation" of Cuba was counterproductive, he said.
Patterson gave no dates for his visit.

Grenadan Prime Minister Keith Mitchell went to Cuba for an official visit last month. He invited Castro to attend next year's Caribbean Community (Caricom) summit to celebrate the regional organisation's 25th anniversary.
